w:r.w:t: Subject: How to prepare vocabulary sets for the ESL Word Scramble project (format + delivery instructions)

We’re preparing many vocabulary variants for the ESL Word Scramble game. Please prepare each variant using one of the accepted formats below and follow the naming/quality rules so we can automatically ingest them into the repo and publish variants quickly.
variant metadata + an array/list of words with a short hint for each word.
Accepted input formats: JSON (preferred), CSV, Excel (.xlsx), or Google Sheet.
must be lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens only (no
We load variants at runtime with the URL pattern:
the vocabulary item (prefer uppercase; loader will uppercase if not).
one short sentence / phrase that helps the learner.
Per-variant metadata (in JSON manifest or file header):
description — 1–2 sentence description of the variant
word": "CHECK-IN COUNTER", "hint": "Place to show ticket & ID; get your boarding pass.
word": "BOARDING PASS", "hint": "Document that gives you access to the plane.
One row per word. Required column header names (case-insensitive):
Optional columns: difficulty, tags, example, audio, image
Save CSV as UTF-8. For Excel, send .xlsx with the same headers on the first sheet.
Share view/edit link OR export as CSV/XLSX.
If you share via Google Sheets, please set sharing to “Anyone with link can view” or add our team email (we’ll import).
Use all-lowercase letters and hyphens. No
concise — ideally 8–20 words, no long paragraphs (<= 140 chars).
Avoid duplicates within a single variant.
audio/image URLs, ensure they are public URLs (HTTPS preferred).
array must contain at least 5 entries.
Duplicate words in the same variant will be flagged.
Any malformed items will be reported back.
and submit a single PR to the template repo.
For a large batch (e.g., ~150 variants), prepare a ZIP with the
folder and a manifest.csv (see manifest below) and upload to the shared drive or create a GitHub branch with the files.
Alternative (if you need separate site per variant)
Use the repo template workflow (we can create this repo as a template). Provide a CSV and we’ll automate repo creation for each variant if needed.
Required manifest for a batch (recommended for 10+ variants)
This helps us track and import automatically.
Example small checklist for each variant (please tick)
name and description filled (JSON) or provided in manifest

If you can provide example sentences and short audio (URL) for pronunciation, we can optionally show those in the game UI. Provide audio files hosted on an accessible CDN or shared drive and include audio column with full URL.
If you prefer, provide an Excel workbook with one sheet per variant named by slug.
Small batches (<= 20 variants): open a GitHub branch / PR with files in
Large batch (~150 variants): upload a ZIP containing
plus manifest.csv to the shared drive and notify us; or create a temporary Git branch and push it for an automated import.
Google Drive links are acceptable if files are shared and downloadable.
If you provide a batch of N variants, please allow 1–3 business days for automated import and smoke testing. For very large batches, we’ll provide a schedule after we see the manifest.
I can provide a small converter script (CSV → JSON) and validate all files in your batch if you prefer — I can run that for you and return a validation report.
If you have questions or want me to run the import/conversion, reply to this message and I’ll handle the automation.
If you will upload to GitHub, please add a PR with the
files and assign me to review.
Short example deliverable (quick copy-paste for one variant)
Thanks — once you provide the first batch (or sample of 5 variants), I’ll run a conversion/validation pass and push everything into the actual
folder so we can test the ?set=<slug> flow and publish.
